channel.title: 2048 in Java
channel.description:
Hey you guys, I'm new here but a friend of mine suggested to post it here. I made a java-based version of the game "2048". I was wondering what you guys thought of it, and how I can improve the game!
Thanks :)

item.title: 2048 in Java
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:12, topic:541422”][quote author=Docent link=topic=660292.msg4423200#msg4423200 date=1399416684]
How do you attach images and downloads?? And this looks interesting, download isn’t working for me though.
[/quote]
Go in the advanced editor and click the attachments and other options button…[/quote]

Hmm i’ve never seen that before, thanks! Lol

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 in Java
item.dc:creator: @gelodarlo gelodarlo
item.description:
@gelodarlo wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:541422”]Lol so hold one of the arrow keys down…

Hello Co-Developer,
Good Day. I tried your 2048 revision in java form, and in comparison to the original 2048 by Gabrielle and in reference with this picture above, the Arithmetic of the game is not similar. For example, [2][2][2][2] when click to the right would be [ ][ ][ ][8]. Second, after completing the 2048 tile the app freezes and asks the user to play again. Lastly, the 2048 tile is black blank tile.
Thanks for reading.
Your reply and code would be of great help in my development of 2048 for Nokia classic phones like Nokia C5 .

  • DM Ilagan[/quote]

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 in Java
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I opened up the controller class to see that you’ve repeated so much code. I want to see you change that!

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 in Java
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Tree, post:7, topic:541422”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=660292.msg4415005#msg4415005 date=1395484479]
Well, since you’re not giving the source code I’ll go ahead and compare it to 2048 that Gabriel made.

You are supposed to start with 2 tiles instead of one.
There’s no animations, like he as (this is just aesthetics, not a real issue).
You never lose.
I can’t seem to close the jar lol. (by clicking the x, I used end process).
It doesn’t seem to have the right algorithm for spawning new shapes as his does, as i was hitting the arrow keys in the same sequence and didn’t lose for 4x the average time I would on 2048.

Edit: the game froze at 3564 score. All tiles are filled but I still have combinations. I think there’s an error.

Edit 2: Nothing showed when I ran it in the command prompt, only seems to freeze around 2500-3000+ score.
[/quote]

I haven’t bothered to actually look at Gabriel’s properly but I’m fairly sure that it’s just random tile placement.

From https://github.com/gabrielecirulli/2048/

[code]
// Adds a tile in a random position
GameManager.prototype.addRandomTile = function () {
if (this.grid.cellsAvailable()) {
var value = Math.random() < 0.9 ? 2 : 4;
var tile = new Tile(this.grid.randomAvailableCell(), value);

this.grid.insertTile(tile);

}
};
[/code][/quote]
Hm, his always looked like it went in a pattern (at least to me).

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 in Java
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:541422”]Well, since you’re not giving the source code I’ll go ahead and compare it to 2048 that Gabriel made.

You are supposed to start with 2 tiles instead of one.
There’s no animations, like he as (this is just aesthetics, not a real issue).
You never lose.
I can’t seem to close the jar lol. (by clicking the x, I used end process).
It doesn’t seem to have the right algorithm for spawning new shapes as his does, as i was hitting the arrow keys in the same sequence and didn’t lose for 4x the average time I would on 2048.

Edit: the game froze at 3564 score. All tiles are filled but I still have combinations. I think there’s an error.

Edit 2: Nothing showed when I ran it in the command prompt, only seems to freeze around 2500-3000+ score.[/quote]

I haven’t bothered to actually look at Gabriel’s properly but I’m fairly sure that it’s just random tile placement.

From https://github.com/gabrielecirulli/2048/

// Adds a tile in a random position
GameManager.prototype.addRandomTile = function () {
  if (this.grid.cellsAvailable()) {
    var value = Math.random() < 0.9 ? 2 : 4;
    var tile = new Tile(this.grid.randomAvailableCell(), value);

    this.grid.insertTile(tile);
  }
};

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 in Java
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“KoenVE, post:3, topic:541422”]Oh i thought I added the source, my fault… :palm:
At the moment you can only end the game either by “dying” or pressing command-Q / alt-f4 but i was thinking of making a “quit” button somewhere?
There’s no real special algorithm for spawning new shapes, it just picks a random tile …
The game never froze when I tested it, so that’s kinda weird :s

Thanks for the feedback!

ps: I added the source to this message[/quote]
Yeah so reading through your source. Uh, you have so many for loops.
I feel like these could have been stored in a hashmap…

Read full topic

item.title: 2048 in Java
item.dc:creator: @KoenVE KoenVE
item.description:
@KoenVE wrote:

Oh i thought I added the source, my fault… :palm:
At the moment you can only end the game either by “dying” or pressing command-Q / alt-f4 but i was thinking of making a “quit” button somewhere?
There’s no real special algorithm for spawning new shapes, it just picks a random tile …
The game never froze when I tested it, so that’s kinda weird :s

Thanks for the feedback!

ps: I added the source to this message

Read full topic
